verses.text: But it \w displeased|strong="H3415"\w* \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w* \w exceedingly|strong="H1419"\w*, and he was very \w angry|strong="H2734"\w*.

And he \w prayed|strong="H6419"\w* unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, I \w pray|strong="H0577"\w* thee, O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, \add was\add* not this my \w saying|strong="H1697"\w*, when I was yet in my \w country|strong="H0127"\w*? Therefore I \w fled|strong="H1272"\w* \w before|strong="H6923"\w* unto \w Tarshish|strong="H8659"\w*: for I \w knew|strong="H3045"\w* that thou \add art\add* a \w gracious|strong="H2587"\w* \w God|strong="H0410"\w*, and \w merciful|strong="H7349"\w*, \w slow|strong="H0750"\w* to \w anger|strong="H0639"\w*, and of \w great|strong="H7227"\w* \w kindness|strong="H2617"\w*, and \w repentest|strong="H5162"\w* thee of the \w evil|strong="H7451"\w*.

Therefore now, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \w take|strong="H3947"\w*, I beseech thee, my \w life|strong="H5315"\w* from me; for \add it is\add* \w better|strong="H2896"\w* for me to \w die|strong="H4194"\w* than to \w live|strong="H2416"\w*.
¶ Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Doest thou \w well|strong="H3190"\w* to be \w angry|strong="H2734"\w*?\f + \fr 4.4 \ft Doest…: or, Art thou greatly angry?\f*

So \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w* went \w out|strong="H3318"\w* of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and \w sat|strong="H3427"\w* on the east \w side|strong="H6924"\w* of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and there \w made|strong="H6213"\w* him a \w booth|strong="H5521"\w*, and \w sat|strong="H3427"\w* under it in the \w shadow|strong="H6738"\w*, till he might \w see|strong="H7200"\w* what would become of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w prepared|strong="H4487"\w* a \w gourd|strong="H7021"\w*, and made \add it\add* to come \w up|strong="H5927"\w* over \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w*, that it might be a \w shadow|strong="H6738"\w* over his \w head|strong="H7218"\w*, to \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* him from his \w grief|strong="H7451"\w*. So \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w* was \w exceeding|strong="H1419"\w* \w glad|strong="H8055"\w* of the \w gourd|strong="H7021"\w*.\f + \fr 4.6 \ft gourd: or, palmcrist: Heb. Kikajon\f*\f + \fr 4.6 \ft was…: Heb. rejoiced with great joy\f*

But \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w prepared|strong="H4487"\w* a \w worm|strong="H8438"\w* when the \w morning|strong="H7837"\w* \w rose|strong="H5927"\w* the next \w day|strong="H4283"\w*, and it \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* the \w gourd|strong="H7021"\w* that it \w withered|strong="H3001"\w*.

And it came to pass, when the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w* did \w arise|strong="H2224"\w*, that \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w prepared|strong="H4487"\w* a \w vehement|strong="H2759"\w* \w east|strong="H6921"\w* \w wind|strong="H7307"\w*; and the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w* \w beat|strong="H5221"\w* upon the \w head|strong="H7218"\w* of \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w*, that he \w fainted|strong="H5968"\w*, and \w wished|strong="H7592"\w* in \w himself|strong="H5315"\w* to \w die|strong="H4191"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \add It is\add* \w better|strong="H2896"\w* for me to \w die|strong="H4194"\w* than to \w live|strong="H2416"\w*.\f + \fr 4.8 \ft vehement: or, silent\f*

And \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* to \w Jonah|strong="H3124"\w*, Doest thou \w well|strong="H3190"\w* to be \w angry|strong="H2734"\w* for the \w gourd|strong="H7021"\w*? And he \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, I do \w well|strong="H3190"\w* to be \w angry|strong="H2734"\w*, \add even\add* unto \w death|strong="H4194"\w*.\f + \fr 4.9 \ft Doest…: or, Art thou greatly angry?\f*\f + \fr 4.9 \ft I do well…: or, I am greatly angry\f*

Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Thou hast had \w pity|strong="H2347"\w* on the \w gourd|strong="H7021"\w*, for the which thou hast not \w laboured|strong="H5998"\w*, neither madest it \w grow|strong="H1431"\w*; which came up in a \w night|strong="H1121"\w*, and \w perished|strong="H0006"\w* in a \w night|strong="H1121"\w*:\f + \fr 4.10 \ft had pity: or, spared\f*\f + \fr 4.10 \ft came…: Heb. was the son of the night\f*

And should not I \w spare|strong="H2347"\w* \w Nineveh|strong="H5210"\w*, that \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, wherein \w are|strong="H3426"\w* \w more|strong="H7235"\w* than \w sixscore|strong="H8147"\w* \w thousand|strong="H7239"\w* \w persons|strong="H0120"\w* that cannot \w discern|strong="H3045"\w* between their right \w hand|strong="H3225"\w* and their left \w hand|strong="H8040"\w*; and \add also\add* \w much|strong="H7227"\w* \w cattle|strong="H0929"\w*?
